questions.text: Which of the following is not true about physiology of nose

options.label: A
options.text: The inspiratory and expiratory air currents pass through middle part of nasal cavity

options.label: B
options.text: Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

options.label: C
options.text: Nasal cilia beat 10-20 times per second and mucociliary clearance time is 10 -20 minutes.

options.label: D
options.text: Nasal cycle of rhythmic congestion and decongestion varies every 2.5 to 4 hours

questions.correct_answer: B. Sinuses are mainly ventilated during inspiratory phase of respiration

questions.text: Where does to given sinus drain into:

A 62 year old man comes to emergency at 4.00 am with severe epistaxis and high blood pressure (180/110mm Hg). Management of hypertension started. But the epistaxis could not be controlled on anterior nasal packing and posterior nasal packing. What is the next best management of this patient--

options.label: C
options.text: Foley’s catheter placement in the nose and inflate the bulb

questions.correct_answer: B. Endoscopic ligation of Sphenopalatine artery

questions.text: Which of the following does not contribute to formation of nasal septum
The internal nasal valve is best defined by which of the following structures?

options.label: A
options.text: Nasal septum, cephalic margin of the upper lateral cartilages, and the nasal floor

options.label: B
options.text: Nasal septum, caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, and nasal floor

options.label: C
options.text: Nasal septum, mid-portion of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, nasal floor, and pyriform aperture

options.label: D
options.text: Nasal floor, head of the inferior turbinate, and head of the middle turbinate

questions.correct_answer: B. Nasal septum, caudal margin of the upper lateral cartilages, head of the inferior turbinate, and nasal floor

questions.text: Which of the following is most true regarding allergic fungal rhinosinusitis?

options.label: A
options.text: It should be treated with surgical removal of mucin and polyps.

options.label: B
options.text: Fungal stains and cultures are not necessary.

options.label: C
options.text: Postoperative oral corticosteroids are not as important as preoperative administration.

options.label: D
options.text: Topical antifungal medications reduce postoperative mucosal inflammation.

questions.correct_answer: A. It should be treated with surgical removal of mucin and polyps.

questions.text: Which of the following can lead to Rhinolalia clausa?

Choose the correct statements regarding the pathology shown in the slide: 1. Disease usually starts in the nose 2. The histological findings are more characteristic and diagnostic in the fibrotic stage. 3. External nose and upper lip giving a “woody” feel 4. Subglottic stenosis may be associated. 5. Nodules are painless and nonulcerative
All of the following are true about Rhinosporidiosis except

options.label: A
options.text: Dapsone is the treatment of choice in this condition

options.label: B
options.text: Can involve oral cavity, conjunctiva along with nose

options.label: D
options.text: Rhinosporidium seeberi is being recently described as an aquatic parasite of the class- mesomycetozoea

questions.correct_answer: A. Dapsone is the treatment of choice in this condition

questions.text: A 51 year-old male complained of nasal obstruction for one year, associated with hyposmia and mucopurulent rhinorrhea. He did not complain of epistaxis, headache or visual impairment.The otorhinolaryngological exam revealed inferior nasal turbinate moderate hypertrophy and mucosa paleness, with mucopurulent secretion. Oroscopy and otoscopy did not show alterations.Video-nasofibroscopy showed a large amount of mucopurulent secretion, associated with a lobulated and polypoid tumor, of rough surface and firm, occupying the lateral wall of both nasal cavities. Correlate the findings and choose the most appropriate diagnosis:
Which of the following is true with regard to cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) leak after tem- poral bone fracture?

options.label: A
options.text: High-resolution CT shows potential sites of CSF leak in less than half of cases.

options.label: B
options.text: CSF leak after temporal bone trauma rarely closes with conservative management.

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical intervention is required in all patients who have temporal bone fractures.

options.label: D
options.text: The most significant risk factor for meningitis after temporal bone fracture is duration of CSF leak

questions.correct_answer: D. The most significant risk factor for meningitis after temporal bone fracture is duration of CSF leak

questions.text: After laparoscopic appendicectomy, patient had fall from bed on her nose after which she had swelling in nose and difficulty in breathing. Next step in management:

options.label: D
options.text: Discharge after 2 days and follow-up of the patients after 8 weeks

questions.text: An operation called Reduction Rhinoplasty reduces the size of the framework of the nose is for:

The facial recess (FR) is the route used in posterior tympanotomy to perform cochlear implantation surgery,Which of the following are anatomical boundaries of Facial recess? 1. Short process of Incus 2. Horizontal segment of facial nerve 3. Vertical segment of facial nerve 4. Chorda tympani nerve
Which of the following anatomical relationships is key to surgical identification of the endolymphatic sac?

options.label: A
options.text: Posterior to the lateral semicircular canal

options.label: B
options.text: Posterior and inferior to the posterior semicircular canal

questions.correct_answer: B. Posterior and inferior to the posterior semicircular canal

questions.text: The organ of Corti is located in which of the following fluid compartment?
Which of the following best monitors and/or best measures the integrity of cochlear blood supply?
Comment on the diagnosis:

options.label: A
options.text: Right Conductive Deafness and Left Sensorineural Deafness.

options.label: B
options.text: Right Conductive Deafness and Left Conductive Deafness.n

options.label: C
options.text: Right Sensorineural Deafness and Left Conductive Deafness.

options.label: D
options.text: Right Sensorineural Deafness and Left Sensorineural Deafness.

questions.correct_answer: C. Right Sensorineural Deafness and Left Conductive Deafness.

questions.text: Study the given pure tone audiogram and comment on the best possible findings

options.label: A
options.text: Right Rinne’s Positive and weber lateralized to left ear.

options.label: B
options.text: Right Rinne’s Negative and weber lateralized to right ear.

options.label: C
options.text: Left Rinne’s Positive and weber lateralized to right ear.

options.label: D
options.text: Left Rinne’s Negative and weber lateralized to left ear.

questions.correct_answer: A. Right Rinne’s Positive and weber lateralized to left ear.

questions.text: A 51-year-old male patient has suffered from fluctuating right sensorineural hearing loss with vertigo since 2018. In May 2022, he was first admitted due to a severe vertigo attack accompanied by right sensorineural hearing loss. After four months, tympanic tube insertion was preformed in the right tympanic membrane. Intratympanic injection of dexamethasone was ineffective. Choose the most appropriate statement regarding the diagnosis.

options.label: A
options.text: SISI score is better than 70% in two-thirds of the patients.

options.label: B
options.text: Schwartz’s sign is seen in early stage only.

questions.correct_answer: A. SISI score is better than 70% in two-thirds of the patients.

questions.text: Which audiological finding does not suggest a acoustic neuroma?

options.label: B
options.text: Abnormally reduced or asymmetric speech discrimination

questions.text: A 72-year-old woman presents with an asymmetric sensorineural hearing loss. What is the most important step in her evaluation and treatment?
A patient of head injury suffered tympanic membrane perforation with ossicular dislocation. How much conductive hearing loss is expected in this patient?
Which statement about otoacoustic emissions (OAEs) is false?

options.label: B
options.text: The middle and external ear status influences the results of the emission.

options.label: C
options.text: Accurate measurement of hearing levels may be predicted.

options.label: D
options.text: In young infants, the low-frequency emission may be reduced.

questions.correct_answer: C. Accurate measurement of hearing levels may be predicted.

questions.text: Which of the following statements are true regarding caloric testing?

options.label: A
options.text: It is accomplished using water 7° C cooler and 7° C warmer than core body temperature.

options.label: B
options.text: The patient is positioned 30 degrees from supine to allow the posterior semicircular canal to be in a vertical plane.

options.label: C
options.text: With a patient’s head 45 degrees from supine, ampullifugal endolymphatic flow in the lateral semicircular canal is established.

options.label: D
options.text: Modified kobrak caloric test use 37° C water to stimulate semicircular canal.

questions.correct_answer: A. It is accomplished using water 7° C cooler and 7° C warmer than core body temperature.

questions.text: All of the following are concerned with auditory pathways except:
What is not true about Toss and Sade’s classification of retraction of tympanic membrane—

options.label: A
options.text: Tos classification grades retraction of pars flaccida

options.label: B
options.text: Sade classification grades retraction of pars tensa

options.label: C
options.text: Grade 4 Sade’s classification is atelectatic otitis media

options.label: D
options.text: Grade 4 Tos classification indicates severe erosion of outer attic wall

questions.correct_answer: C. Grade 4 Sade’s classification is atelectatic otitis media

questions.text: Post-lingual deafness is a deafness which develops after the acquisition of speech and language, usually after the age of
Which of the following is the safe limit of noise levels in a city
The given investigation in the picture checks the function of which structure of inner ear?
Which of the following can be inferred from the type of otic capsule fracture present on CT scan?

options.label: A
options.text: Patients with otic capsule-sparing fractures are less likely to have cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) fistula.

options.label: B
options.text: Facial nerve injury is more likely when the otic capsule is not involved.

options.label: C
options.text: Sensorineural hearing loss is not related to the type of fracture present.

options.label: D
options.text: Otic capsule-sparing fractures typically result from a blow to the occipital region.

questions.correct_answer: A. Patients with otic capsule-sparing fractures are less likely to have cerebrospinal fluid (CSF) fistula.

questions.text: What type of tympanogram is given in the picture?
Identify the maneuver given in image
Identify the structure medial to the arrow in the picture?
Choose the most inappropriate statement regarding disease shown in given Fig:

options.label: A
options.text: Foul smelling scanty discharge is a feature

options.label: B
options.text: Due to embryonal rests of epithelial cells persisting within the middle ear cleft

options.label: C
options.text: The two weakest and most vulnerable parts of the tympanic membrane are its most superior aspect and the posterosuperior quadrant.

options.label: D
options.text: Aim of management is to improve hearing status.

questions.correct_answer: D. Aim of management is to improve hearing status.

questions.text: A 46-year-old female presented with two to three days of right external ear pain, without fever or headache. She denied feeling pain deeper in the ear area. She had no history of similar ear pain or recent ear infection.Examination revealed mild erythema, swelling, and tenderness of the middle of the external ear (Fig). There was no fluctuance. The ear canal and tympanic membrane were both normal. She had no erythema, swelling, or tenderness of the mastoid or the face, and no other area of redness or rash on the head. Which bacteria are the most common cause of this type of infection?
A child presenting with recurrent respiratory tract infection, mouth breathing and decreased hearing, study the given toposcopic image and choose the most appropriate statement?

options.label: A
options.text: Tympanostomy tubes are usually required for treatment

options.label: B
options.text: Sensorineural deafness occurs as a complication in 80% of the cases

options.label: C
options.text: Intracranial spread of the infection complicates the clinical courses

options.label: D
options.text: Gram-positive organisms are grown routinely in culture in the aspirate

questions.correct_answer: A. Tympanostomy tubes are usually required for treatment

questions.text: A 21-year-old female patient complaints of left ear discharge and hearing loss for 8 years. She did not have any history of systemic diseases. She reported having used intermittent medical treatments including various ear drops and antimicrobials. The physical examination revealed perforated tympanic membrane and cholesteatoma tissue in the epitympanic region of the left ear. Which of the following statement is inappropriate regarding the diagnosis:

options.label: A
options.text: Retraction pockets are the most common cause of cholesteatoma

options.label: B
options.text: Post operative hearing status is better in canal wall down procedures.

options.label: C
options.text: Granulations surrounding the area of osteitis are present

options.label: D
options.text: The cholesteatoma has matrix lined by keratinising stratified squamous epithelium.

questions.correct_answer: B. Post operative hearing status is better in canal wall down procedures.

questions.text: A 40 year old child suffering from right otalgia for 1 month. The patient had no known medical history and complained of hearing impairment and otalgia on the right side. Physical examination showed injected bulging tympanic membrane associated with right postauricular swelling, redness and tenderness (Fig). Further evaluation through pure tone audiometry revealed a mixed hearing loss on the right side with 60 dB air conduction level and 30 dB air-bone gap. Radiologic examinations of temporal bone CT and MRI showed soft tissue density filling the right middle ear and mastoid cavity.Which of the following is true regarding intact canal wall tympanomastoidectomy for cholesteatoma?

options.label: A
options.text: The rate of recurrent cholesteatoma is high.

options.label: C
options.text: It provides long-term visualization of the mastoid antrum.

options.label: D
options.text: It has worse hearing results than canal-wall-down tympanomastoidectomy.

questions.correct_answer: A. The rate of recurrent cholesteatoma is high.

questions.text: A 55-year-old female with underlying hypertension and diabetes mellitus presented to our institution with a history of right ear pulsatile tinnitus and progressive right side hearing diminution for 10 years duration. On otoscopy examination of the right ear, there were no evident abnormalities regarding the external ear or external auditory canal, but a reddish pulsatile mass was seen on right tympanic membrane with a bulging tympanic membrane as shown in the image. Which of the following artery should be embolized to reduce intraoperative bleeding:
Known types of presbycusis can be attributed to each of the following except
questions.correct_answer: D. Degeneration of the ossicular joint

questions.text: Which of the following best identifies the appropriate tools to screen for newborn hearing loss in accordance with the Joint Committee on Infant Hearing guidelines?
Choose the most inappropraite statement regarding patient shown below:

options.label: A
options.text: 10 day course of oral steroids +/- oral acyclovir

options.label: B
options.text: Treatment should begin within 72 hours of symptom onset

options.label: C
options.text: Intratympanic steroid injection may be tried.

options.label: D
options.text: Facial nerve decompression should be done for fast recovery

questions.correct_answer: D. Facial nerve decompression should be done for fast recovery

questions.text: A patient of bell’s palsy shows no improvement with 3 weeks of steroid therapy.What should be the next steps in the management 1. Physiotherapy 2. Continue with steroids 3. Electroneuromyography 4. Facial nerve decompression if degeneration present. 5. Transtympanic dexamethasone
Identify the hearing Aid shown in the image:
Identify the three primary components of the “BAHA” Bone Conduction System as shown in the Fig:

options.label: A
options.text: A= Sound processor B= Abutment C= Titanium implant

options.label: B
options.text: B= Sound processor C= Abutment A= Titanium implant

options.label: C
options.text: C= Sound processor A= Abutment C= Titanium implant

options.label: D
options.text: C= Sound processor B= Abutment A= Titanium implant

questions.correct_answer: A. A= Sound processor B= Abutment C= Titanium implant

questions.text: A six-month-old child born with bilateral bony atresia is seen for an audiological evaluation and treatment recommendation. Radiological evidence indicates the probable presence of an intact middle ear and cochlea.ABR responses have been obtained at near-normal levels to bone-conducted signals. Of the following, the most appropriate course of action for this child at this time would be to

options.label: A
options.text: Defer treatment until growth of the external and middle ear is complete at about age 6

options.label: B
options.text: Suggest that surgery be initiated on at least one ear to permit a normal air-conducted pathway

options.label: C
options.text: Investigate the use of a bone-conduction hearing aid until audiological test results can be confirmed and surgery initiated when the child is older

options.label: D
options.text: Counsel the parents concerning sign language and initiate a treatment program based on the use of all visual cues

questions.correct_answer: C. Investigate the use of a bone-conduction hearing aid until audiological test results can be confirmed and surgery initiated when the child is older

questions.text: Identify the circular part of cochlear implant placed on the side of scalp (given in the picture)

15 year-old male, presents with left hearing loss since birth and left facial paralysis from the age of 3 years and 6 months, during one of the innumerous episodes of otorrhea and otalgia experienced during childhood. Physical examination showed left peripheral facial palsy Temporal bone computed tomography (CT scan) showed complete absence of inner ear cavities on the left. Patient was planned for auditory rehabilitation.The implant will be designed to stimulate the
Select the most appropriate statement regarding pathology shown in given Fig:

options.label: B
options.text: Calcification only within the tympanic membrane

options.label: C
options.text: Surgical intervention in most of cases

options.label: D
options.text: Grommet can be used in resistant cases.

questions.correct_answer: A. Hearing aids may be beneficial

questions.text: All are true about the characteristics of Laryngomalacia except

options.label: D
options.text: Conservative management is the ideal plan

questions.correct_answer: B. Stridor decreases in prone position

questions.text: Which of the following airway obstruction level causes inspiratory stridor?

A 2-year-old patient presents with mild aspiration with liquids. All diagnostic examinations were unremarkable. Direct laryngoscopy and palpation of larynx revealed a dehiscence above the level of cricoid through the arytenoid musculature. What grade laryngeal cleft does the child have?

Tom is a 21-year-old male who seeks evaluation for his voice. Tom states that his voice did not change much after puberty. Throughout high school, his voice has had no impact on him, nor did it affect him socially. However, his voice continued to maintain its pitch, and as time progressed, it was noted by Tom and his mother that his voice is sounding a bit higher in pitch and has developed a slightly strained quality when he speaks.His fiberoptic laryngoscopy is normal. The clinician has advised him for speech therapy in which he is asked to phonate while pulling the thyroid cartilage downwards and pressing it backwards.Which thyroplasty can be beneficial in the patient ?
All of the following are appropriate associations on radiologic evaluations except:

options.label: C
options.text: Air trapping on chest radiograph–vocal cord immobility

options.label: D
options.text: Thickened soft tissue overlying C-spine–retropharyngeal abscess

questions.correct_answer: C. Air trapping on chest radiograph–vocal cord immobility

questions.text: Identify the condition shown in image:

A 5-year-old boy presents with 2 years of hoarseness. He has no symptoms of cough- ing or throat clearing. His mother reports that he is a screamer. He has a breathy raspy voice, and stroboscopy reveals symmetric bilateral lesions in the mid membra- nous vocal fold. What is the most appropriate step in the initial management of this patient?
When should permanent treatment for vocal fold paralysis be undertaken?

options.label: A
options.text: No earlier than 6 months after onset

options.label: B
options.text: When laryngeal electromyography (LEMG) demonstrates poor prognosis for recovery

questions.correct_answer: B. When laryngeal electromyography (LEMG) demonstrates poor prognosis for recovery

questions.text: Which of the following describes Type III cordectomy correctly?

Individuals with vocal cord paralysis may find the effectiveness of coughing, swallowing or sneezing in removing laryngeal area waste is undermined reduced vocal cord mobility.Choose the most inappropriate statement regarding “Neural paralysis of the larynx”

options.label: A
options.text: Aspiration is more likely if the superior laryngeal nerve is affected.

options.label: B
options.text: If due to bronchial carcinoma the primary pathology is easily diagnosed in most cases.

options.label: C
options.text: Semon's law states that in a progressive lesion the adductors are affected before the abductors.

options.label: D
options.text: The cartilage of Wrisberg becomes more prominent

questions.correct_answer: C. Semon's law states that in a progressive lesion the adductors are affected before the abductors.

questions.text: A 56 year old male patient suffering from thyroid carcinoma underwent total thyroidectomy. While surgery, both side recurrent laryngeal nerves got damaged. What are the expected post operative symptoms of patient? 1. Poor quality of voice 2. Respiratory distress 3. Aspiration 4. Normal voice
All are constituents of the management of Juvenile papilloma of larynx except 1. Intralesional Cidofovir 2. Interferon alpha 3. CO2 laser surgery 4. Endotracheal intubation 5. Tracheostomy

CT scan of neck of a patient of carcinoma larynx has been found to have the involvement of epiglottis, right ventricular band, right true vocal cord and invading into pre-epiglottic space. What is the ideal treatment of this patient?
Study the given instrument,it is being used for:
In the postoperative care of tracheostomy

options.label: A
options.text: Accidental decannulation after 2 weeks should be treated as an emergency.

options.label: B
options.text: Copious mucus production indicates a pulmonary infection.

options.label: C
options.text: A poorly positioned tracheostomy tube may produce a fatal haemorrhage.

options.label: D
options.text: Prolapsed cuff is the commonest causes of obstruction.

questions.correct_answer: C. A poorly positioned tracheostomy tube may produce a fatal haemorrhage.

questions.text: All of the following statements are true regarding the pathology shown in given image except :

options.label: A
options.text: Superficial layer of the lamina propria is involved.

options.label: D
options.text: Antireflux medications should be given trial.

questions.correct_answer: A. Superficial layer of the lamina propria is involved.

questions.text: Congenital defects may arise as a result of disturbances of the orderly embryological development of structures originating from the primitive branchial apparatus. Defects of the second branchial apparatus have an internal opening in the:
Which of the following is true of diagnostic testing of laryngopharyngeal reflux (LPR)?

options.label: A
options.text: A 24-hour dual-probe pH testing is highly effective at identifying those with acid reflux.

options.label: B
options.text: Presence of esophagitis on esophagoscopy is necessary to diagnose LPR.

options.label: C
options.text: A positive response to acid-suppressive therapy is diagnostic of LPR.

options.label: D
options.text: Demonstration of abnormal lower esophageal sphincter (LES) pressures on manom- etry is diagnostic of LPR.

questions.correct_answer: A. A 24-hour dual-probe pH testing is highly effective at identifying those with acid reflux.

questions.text: Blood supply to the palatine tonsil is derived from branches of which of the following arteries?
The pathology specimen in a patient with squamous cell carcinoma of the tonsillar fossa without a history of smoking or drinking often is positive for which of the following?

A 14-year-old previously healthy male patient presented to the emergency department (ED) with fever, throat pain, and difficulty breathing. The patient was found to have a right-sided sore throat, pain while swallowing, odynophagia, poor oral (p.o.) intake, right neck tenderness, and a fever of 40.1°C. The patient also reported a recent development of trismus and muffled “hot potato” voice. Upon an evaluation, unilateral swelling occupying the pharyngeal cavity, fever 38.4 Celsius and dyspnea was noted. Poor oral hygiene was observed. Choose the incorrect statement regarding the diagnosis:

options.label: A
options.text: Lymph node infection is most common cause in this age group.

options.label: B
options.text: Can be palpated by finger at the post pharyngeal wall

options.label: C
options.text: It is present up to the level of hyoid bone.

options.label: D
options.text: Pre Vertebral abscess is very close diagnosis

questions.correct_answer: C. It is present up to the level of hyoid bone.

questions.text: A 66 year old Chinese man presents with a two month history of neck swelling in the right posterior triangle. On further questioning he tells you that his hearing has also declined in the right ear. He also has a blocked nose. What is the likely diagnosis?

options.label: B
options.text: Metastatic lymph node from a nasopharyngeal carcinoma.

options.label: D
options.text: Metastatic lymph node from a oropharyngeal carcinoma.

questions.correct_answer: B. Metastatic lymph node from a nasopharyngeal carcinoma.

questions.text: All of the following are true about juvenile angiofibroma except

options.label: A
options.text: CECT scan shows Hollman Miller Sign

options.label: B
options.text: Wilson transpalatal approach is ideal for angiofibroma limited to nose & nasopharynx

options.label: C
options.text: Sphenopalatine artery should be embolized before surgery.

options.label: D
options.text: Superior margin of sphenopalatine foramen is the most common site of origin

questions.correct_answer: C. Sphenopalatine artery should be embolized before surgery.

questions.text: Cuffed ETTs are sometimes used in children for tonsillectomy and adenoidectomy to prevent blood from leaking into the trachea. Which of the following complications does high cuff pressure often predispose the patient to?

Which of the following is a true statement about complications following tonsillectomy? 1. Secondary bleeding is more common than primary bleeding. 2. In a child with submucous cleft palate, tonsillectomy is contraindicated. 3. Children under 3 years are more likely to have respiratory complications. 4. Children have more postoperative complications than adults.
